fields.Transcription: Përshëndetje, Unë jam Julian Kuqi. Jam shqiptari Shqipëris, që jetoj qe tre vjet n'Prishtinë. Jam djali i vetëm n'familje, jam fëmijë i pestë, i kam dy motra ma të mdhaja, që kanë qenë shumicës e kohës jo me mu, e ato kanë studiu n'Itali të dyjat, janë shumë mat mdhaja se unë. Sipas dërave të, nji instituti anglez mos po bojmë. Prejardhja e familjes ashtë nga shqiptart e Malit Zi, para pesëte gjashtë shekujsh, pastaj qe aty kanë zbritur n'Shkodër, ku e kanë emëru q'atë vendin ku kanë ndejt n'Kuqë, ashtë siç e kam edhe mbiemrin Kuqi. Pastaj për shkak se thuhet që kemi qenë shumë fis problematik, agallaret e vendit na kanë lëviz prej atyit e kanë dhon tokë, e na kanë çuar, atë qi sod quhet Karadaku i Kosovës. Karadaku në Malt Zi, në Turqisht domethonë Malt Zi, Karadak, edhe thuhet qi n'fakt i pari fisit tonë qi kanë shku aty në këtë tokë e ka marr emrin Karadak. Pastaj qe aty kanë zbrit n'Dibër n'Peshkopi, edhe aty pastaj kanë vazhdu, ashtë babi im, ku n'fakt kam lind edhe unë po s'kam eduku, qyteti i pjesë Dibrës ashtë, dhe i lindja Shqipërisë. Dy mijë e nimdheten erdha n'Prishtinë, për shkak se babi e tremdhetë vjeç jeton ktu, edhe punon ktu. Ashtë rast i rallë, se zakonisht (nuk kohë me ra?), ka shumë njerz që ky jeton atje e studjojnë atje. I tjetër bind interisante n'familje ashtë feja, ne jemi shumë, t'miksum n'religjon, jena shumë përzim, se mami ashtë ortodokse, relativishte e devotshme, i feston festat, edhe desje kishë, shkon n'kishë. Babi ashtë musliman i devotshëm, që falet sa, ma special, tre herë a sati dy. Unë jam roman catholic, katolik, i - jo i devotshëm po katolik. Ndërsa motrat e mia janë sa lloj krishterësh qi janë monotoiza aq. Ndërsa përsepër ketë linguistik dialekteve, gjuha ashtë një nga gjërat ma artificial në shoqëror, ashtë marrveshja e pastër. Nuk asgjë atyrale n'të, por veç ni fenomeni që, tash nuk më kujtohet emri, ashtë ni fenomen që mbas, domethonë, saundeve e emrat pastër, të tingujve marrin, që bëjmë, marrin emrin gjë. Edhe kjo ashtë gjë ma pra natyres, përsa i përketë gjuhës. Pse ktu ashtë ni marrveshje, si marrveshje, mendoj qi Shqipja duhet, qi të adaptohet me dialektet më shumë që të rifërskohet gjuha standarde e fjalori shtalte-dyshit qi ish bo. Për shkak shumë arsyeve politike, domethonë...Mirë po, sod gjuha standarde ashtë shumë prejashtuse përparë fjalë. Prejashton shumë fjalë që tingloj shumë më mirë në dialektin Arvanitas, në dialektin Toskë, në dialektin Gegë, në dialektin Arbëreshëve. Arbëreshët miqër (?) në pasuri shumë e madhe e Shqiptarve, sidomos kur vjen puna te gjuha linguistik. E me të do ta mbyll me thonë që gjuha ashtë marrveshje e pastër mes njerzve, takës ose divanit kishim mujtë me thonë kpuc edhe kpucës divanit edhe kshtu n'vazhdim. E di kush qi ashtë marrveshja athere ashtë ni artificje që mund ta integrojmë më shumë me përdishmërin e mirëtinen tonë.﻿
fields.Translation: Hello, i am Julian Kuqi. I am an Albanian of Albania, who has been living in Pristina for 3 years. I am the only son of the family, i am the 5th child, i have 2 older sisters who most of the time havent been with me, they have both studied in Italy, they re much more older than me. According to the data of an English institute, if im not mistaken, the origin of my family is from the Albanians of Montenegro, before 5 or 6 centuries, then from there, they came down to Shkodër, where they named the place they settled in, Kuq, just like my last name Kuqi. After that, since it is said that we have been a very problematic tribe, aghas (ottoman title) from the region moved us from there and gave us land and took us to a place who nowadays is called Karadak of Kosovo. Karadak in Montenegro (correction) Karadak in Turkish means Montenegro, Karadak, and actually it is said that the first from our tribe who went there on that land gave it the name Karadak. Then, from there they settled down to Dibër, in Peshkopi and they continued there, it is where my father is from, actually i was also born there but never lived. The city of Peshkopi in Dibër is in north-eastern Albania. In 2011 i moved to Pristina, because my father has been working and living here for 13 years. It is a rare occassion, because usually it is the opposite, there are many people from here who live and study there. Another interesting fact of my family is the religion, our religions are very mixed, because my mother is orthodox christian, relatively devoted, she celebrates the religious celebrations, lights candles and goes to the church. My father is a devoted muslim, who prays if not 5,  3 times whenever he has the chance. I have chosen to be catholic, not devoted but still a catholic. Whereas my sisters are some sort of christians....they are monotheist and thats it. Speaking of linguistics and dialects, language is one of the most artificial things that we have, it is a pure agreement there is nothing natural in it. Except a phenomenon, that i cant remember its name, its a phenomenon that based from the sounds that they make (not sure what he s talking about here, the letters probably) they take their name from and this is the most natural thing, speaking of the language. But like this, it is just an agreement, and as an agreement i think that the Albanian language needs to be adapted more with the dialects, in order for the standard language and the vocabulary of 1972 to be refreshed because of many political reasons. Anyway, today the standard language is very exclusive, to cut it short, it excludes many words that sound much better in the Arvanitika dialect, Tosk dialect, Gheg dialect or even Arbëresh. Speaking of them, they are a very big asset of Albanians especially when it comes to the language and linguistics. And with this i will end, saying that the language is a pure agreement between people, we could call a couch, shoe and the opposite etc. And since it is an agreement, it is an artifical thing that we could integrate more in our everyday lives and routines.﻿
Demographics: 1,630,000 in Serbia. Population total all countries: 3,486,100. Ethnic population: 2,000,000 (1998 Los Angeles Times).
YouTube License Statement: The speaker(s) featured herein have not explicitly agreed to distribute this video for reuse. For inquiries on licensing this video, please contact hello@wikitongues.org.
